lead_paragraph: The ensemble’s concert at Zankel Hall included works by Vivaldi and Martinelli dedicated to Chiara, a virtuoso educated at the Ospedale Della Pietà, a Venetian orphanage, in the 1700s.

headline.print_headline: A Cloistered 18th-Century Orphan Whose Virtuosity Charmed the World
headline.main: Review: Europa Galante Tells the Story of a Musical Orphan in ‘Chiara’s Diary’

snippet: The ensemble’s concert at Zankel Hall included works by Vivaldi and Martinelli dedicated to Chiara, a virtuoso educated at the Ospedale Della Pietà, a Venetian orphanage, in the 1700s.
abstract: James R Oestreich reviews concert Chiara's Diary: A Life at the Pieta Orphanage in Venice, 1730-1770, performed by period ensemble Europa Galante at Zankel Hall.
